alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Oxford and northwestern Cumberland Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rumford, moving south at 10 mph. Additional strong storms are expected to develop across this area through 300 PM. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgton, Fryeburg, Bethel, Rumford, Turner, Dixfield, Canton, Waterford, Mexico, Harrison, Buckfield, Brownfield, Hebron, Hartford, Denmark, Lovell, Greenwood, Carthage, West Paris and Woodstock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford
